->> 2 lbs chicken
 (you can use thighs, drumsticks, or a 
 combination)

 ->> 1/2 cup soy sauce

 ->> 1/2 cup vinegar
 (cane vinegar or white vinegar works 
 well)

 --> 4 cloves garlic, minced

 --> 1 onion, sliced

 ->> 3-4 bay leaves

 ->> 1 teaspoon whole peppercorns

 ->> 1 tablespoon cooking oil

 ->> 1 cup water

 ->> Salt and pepper to taste

 ->> Optional: sliced green chilies for 
 added heat

->> In a large bowl, combine the soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, and whole peppercorns. Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, but preferably a few hours or overnight in the refrigerator.


->> Heat oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and sautÃ© until they become translucent.


->> Add the marinated chicken pieces (reserve the marinade) to the pot. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.


--> Pour in the marinade and add bay leaves. Bring to a simmer.


->> Once simmering, add water to the pot. Bring it back to a simmer, cover, and let it cook for about 30-40 minutes, or until the hicken is tender and cooked through. Stir occasionally.


--> Once the chicken is cooked, taste and djust the seasoning with salt and pepper as needed. If you want some heat, you can add sliced green chilies at this point.


->> Serve hot with steamed rice. Enjoy your delicious Chicken Adobo!
